events.source: #Theobald J, Theoblad L. Arizona Territory Post Offices & Postmasters. Phoenix, AZ: Arizona Historical Foundation; 1961:134

events.title: Las Cienegas NCA Land Management Plan Evaluation underway
events.description: The Las Cienegas National Conservation Area (LCNCA) Resource Management Plan (RMP) is being evaluated by the Bureau of Land Management Tucson. Stakeholders were invited into workshops to evaluate how well the 2003 plan goals and actions are being met. Updates are being considered. BLM has not completed the evaluation as of April 2021.

events.title: Southern Pacific RR tracks reach Punta de Agua
events.description: By April 1880, Southern Pacific Railroad tracks make it to Punta de Agua at the confluence of the Pantano Wash and Cienega Creek at the old wagon road. Railroad is constructed as a levee in the broad floodplain of Cienega.
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: Apache raiding in Sonoita, AZ
events.description: Raiding in Sonoita leads to Camp Grant massacre of peaceful Apache, according to early Anglo settlers.
events.source: #Farish TE. A History of Arizona, Volume 2. San Francisco, CA:Filmer Brothers Electrotype Company; 1915:271-281

events.title: Vail School District No. 20 established
events.description: Vail School District No. 20 established by Pima County Board of Supervisors after a petition by Vail residents. District contains Township 16 South, Range 16 East.
events.source: #Lamb JJ. Voices of Vail School Timeline. Vail, AZ: Vail Preservation Society; 2016

events.title: Fire destroys Vail Store & Post Office (Schley's Store)
events.description: The store is rebuilt and open for business by August 1908. The origin of the fire is unknown. The store is the largest of the country stores in the area, serving Helvetia camp and other mining camps as well as local ranches and Southern Pacific Railroad workers.
events.source: #Lamb JJ. The Old Vail Post Office, Connecting the Greater Vail Community Since 1908. The Smoke Signal. The Tucson Corral of the Westerners. 2011. 90

events.title: Erosion treatments at Los Pozos on Las Cienegas NCA
events.description: Sky Island Alliance, Cienega Watershed Partnership, and Bureau of Land Management initiate training and on-site control techniques at the Los Pozos Gully. Using the Bill Zeedyk methodology, over 50 volunteers applied techniques in a series of weekend workshops. The Los Pozos structures are still in place as of 2021.
events.source: #McFarlin S. Land Uses on Las Cienegas National Conservation Area. Personal Communication.Nov 2016.

events.title: Telephone installed at Vail's Siding
events.description: The Helvetia Mining Company pays for the cost of a long distance telephone line from Vail to Helvetia.
events.source: #Helvetia Mining Company. Annual Report. Helvetia, AZ: Helvetia Mining Compnay; 1910

events.title: Tomlinsons assume Empire Ranch grazing lease
events.description: Tomlinson family, owners of the Vera Earl Ranch in Sonoita, enter into an agreement with the Bureau of Land Management to assume the Donaldson Empire Ranch grazing lease. Collaborative process from Resource Management Plan continues.
events.source: #Corkill GW, Hunt SE. Empire Ranch. Charleston, SC: Arcadia Publishing; 2011.:46
events.tags: Bureau of Land Management, Empire Ranch

events.title: Rosemont post office closes
events.description: Rosemont post office closes; Leo T. J. Stone postmaster.
events.source: #Theobald J, Theobald L. Arizona Territory Post Offices & Postmasters. Phoenix, AZ: Arizona Historical Foundation; 1961:124

events.title: Grand Opening for the expanded Colossal Cave Mountain Park
events.description: After years of work to rehabilitate the La Posta Quemada Ranch structures and create two museums, the Grand Opening celebration for the enclosed and gated Colossal Cave Mountain Park takes place January 21-23, 2000.
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: Pantano Post Office closes
events.description: First established in 1880; closes in 1952.

events.title: 6th Annual Science on the Sonoita Plain Symposium
events.description: Annual event at the Audubon-Whittell Audubon Research Ranch focuses on mesquite management and ecology with updates on shared history, paleontology, aerial images, snake studies, black-tailed prairie dog and water releases. Partners: Bureau of Land Management Tucson, Cienega Watershed Partnership, Audubon Research Ranch, The Nature Conservancy, Pima County, University of Arizona, and Pima Association of Governments. The 2014 Science on the Sonoita Plain Breakfast was provided in memory of Grant Drennen, organized by the Cienega Watershed Partnership, and funded from contributions through the Grant Drennen Funds and by the Appleton-Whittell Research Ranch.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.

events.title: JT Rothrock observes Wilson's Phalarope, Baird's and Least Sandpipers at Cienega Creek
events.description: Dr. J.T. Rothrock: 'It [Wilson's Phalarope] was here merely a migrant, and, in company with Baird's and Least Sandpipers, frequented certain little marshy spots, where its actions, as it moved nimbly about in quest of the insects which afford it sustenance, were so much like the Sandpiper's that I did not at first, when at a distance, recognize it. They were as tame and unsuspicious as the Peeps, and, when startled, got up with a peet, peet, not a little resembling the familiar notes of those birds. These marshy places appeared to be the only resorts in the neighborhood ; for after being absent for a few moments they invariably returned to the same spots, and resumed their feeding.'
events.source: #Wheeler GA, Humphreys AA, Wright HG. Report upon United States Geographical Surveys West of the One Hundredth Meridian. Volume 5. Zoology. Washington, DC: Government Printing Office; 1875:451-452

events.title: H.W. Henshaw observes Black-throated bunting at the Cienega
events.description: H.W. Henshaw: 'The abundance of this bunting [Black-throated] in Texas has been attested by several observers. It extends through New Mexico, where it was found by Dr. Woodhouse, and reaches the extreme southeastern portion of Arizona, where I have taken it the past two seasons. In 1873, I supposed it to be a mere straggler in this section, as I saw but a single individual; but the past year we found it occurring in small numbers, usually four or five together, associated sometimes with other sparrows, in the canons and among the brush of the rocky hillsides.'
events.source: #Wheeler GA, Humphreys AA, Wright HG. Report upon United States Geographical Surveys West of the One Hundredth Meridian. Volume 5. Zoology. Washington, DC: Government Printing Office; 1875:295-296

events.title: H.W. Henshaw observes Bachman's Sparrow at Cienega Creek
events.description: H.W. Henshaw: 'The Bachman's Finch (now Bachman's sparrow (Aimophila aestivalis)) of the Southern States is represented in Northern Mexico and along the southern borders of Arizona, and probably also in New Mexico, by this race, which appears to be sufficiently distinguished, as a variety, by its paler coloration, slenderer bill, and longer wings and tail. In Arizona, this sparrow appears to be confined exclusively to the extreme southern portion, and was found abundant only within a few miles of the Mexican border.'
events.source: #Wheeler GA, Humphreys AA, Wright HG. Report upon United States Geographical Surveys West of the One Hundredth Meridian. Volume 5. Zoology. Washington, DC: Government Printing Office; 1875:285-287

events.title: H.W. Henshaw observes Ladder-backed woodpecker at Cienega valley
events.description: H.W. Henshaw: 'In Arizona, the thirty-fourth parallel appears to form about the northern limit of this species [Ladder-backed woodpecker]. Dr. Coues reports it as a summer resident at Fort Whipple, which is slightly farther north than it was found by us to extend in the extreme eastern part, It begins to appear not far south of Camp Apache, and in the Gila Valley and southward becomes common; it is numerous, however, only within about one hundred miles of the southern border. It appears in fall to resemble in its manners the Downy Woodpecker: and its notes, too, are similar. It is by no means an inhabitant of the mountains, but shuns them, and seeks' the warm valleys, in the deciduous trees of which it spends the time actively moving over the branches, spending more time among them than on the main trunks, and now and then descending to the ground. Wherever are found large areas in which is a heavy growth of the mesquite trees, this species may always be looked for with perfect confidence, as these trees of all others attract their attention.'
events.source: #Wheeler GA, Humphreys AA, Wright HG. Report upon United States Geographical Surveys West of the One Hundredth Meridian. Volume 5. Zoology. Washington, DC: Government Printing Office; 1875:390-391

events.title: H.W. Henshaw observes Cassin's Sparrow at Cienega Valley
events.description: H.W. Henshaw: [Cassin’s Sparrow] 'was found by us in Southeastern Arizona, from a point a little north of the Gila River to near the southern border, being distributed evenly over this region, and found very numerous in all localities suited to its nature.'
events.source: #Wheeler GA, Humphreys AA, Wright HG. Report upon United States Geographical Surveys West of the One Hundredth Meridian. Volume 5. Zoology. Washington, DC: Government Printing Office; 1875:288-289

events.title: Hummels stop ranching; sell Kentucky Camp to Anamax
events.description: The last Hummels (Floss and Wert Fenter) stop ranching and sell the Kentucky Camp property to Anamax Mining Company.
events.source: #Orell FL. Kentucky Camp and the Santa Rita Water and Mining Company. Kentucky Camp Chronicle {Newsletter]. 1998. February

events.title: Collaborative Management Adaptive Network Rendezvous at Las Cienegas
events.description:
The Collaborative Adaptive Management Network (CAMNet) meets in Tucson. The professional network and local hosts --Las Cienegas National Conservation Area (LCNCA), The Nature Conservancy, and
 U.S. Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution-- convened the fourth annual Rendezvous in Tucson, Arizona. A number of keynote speakers (national and local), panel discussions and a field trip to Las Cienegas highlight how stakeholders develop mutual objectives, monitor results and fine-tune practices to achieve adaptive management goals.
events.source: #McFarlin S. Land Uses on Las Cienegas National Conservation Area. Personal Communication.Nov 2016.

events.title: Cottonwoods line Cienega Creek near Cienega Station
events.description: Some three miles before arriving at the Station the road winds through the dry bed of the Ciénega, lines on either hand with large cottonwood and other trees, which, if growing in Tucson would make that thriving town to be to be admired by all. Some of the cottonwoods were, by actual measurement, over 12 feet in circumference.
events.source: #Hodge HC. Eastward to Camp Bowie--On and Off the Road. Arizona Citizen. Apr 24, 1875. 5(29):1:1

events.title: Creek has four miles of fine water near Cienega Station
events.description: At Ciénega Stage Station there is a fine living stream of good water reaching up and down for some four miles.
events.source: #Hodge HC. Eastward to Camp Bowie--On and Off the Road. Arizona Citizen. Apr 24, 1875. 5(29):1:1

events.title: Creosote on hills near Cienega Creek
events.description: Near the Cienega there is a most luxuriant growth of Sacaton grass on the flats, which, though of little value in itself, indicates that the soil is capable of producing more important crops. The prevailing vegetation on the hills is the ubiquitous creosote-plant.' From a report by J.T. Rothrock, acting assistant surgeon, U.S. Army, attached to the exploratory party of Lt. George M. Wheeler, Corps of Engineers, 1875.
events.source: #. Southeastern Arizona. Arizona Citizen. Apr 15, 1876. 6(28):4:4

events.title: Sacaton grass on flats near Cienega Creek
events.description: Near the Cienega there is a most luxuriant growth of Sacaton grass on the flats, which, though of little value in itself, indicates that the soil is capable of producing more important crops. The prevailing vegetation on the hills is the ubiquitous creosote-plant.' From a report by J.T. Rothrock, acting assistant surgeon, U.S. Army, attached to the exploratory party of Lt. George M. Wheeler, Corps of Engineers, 1875.
events.source: #. Southeastern Arizona. Arizona Citizen. Apr 15, 1876. 6(28):4:4

events.title: Davidson's spring good, forage nearby
events.description: South of the Cienega the Santa Rita Mountains rise probably 10,500 feet above the sea. Tucson lies west of them; and east we have the headwaters of the Cienega. Davidson's spring is on the road to Sonoita, and twelve miles from the Cienega. Here there is found a good spring, and plenty of forage in the country nearby.
events.source: #. Southeastern Arizona. Arizona Citizen. Apr 15, 1876. 6(28):4:4

events.title: Cienega Valley has grama and bunch grasses, oak, pine, and mesquite
events.description: Following to the south, we ascended first through a fine valley, with everywhere abundance of grama and bunch grasses. Lateral valleys, here and there connected with the main one and the hills between, besides being well covered with the above-named grasses, had oak, pine, and mesquite clumps, the whole combining into a landscape of more than usual attractiveness. In addition to this, a small stream ran through the valley, supplying enough of water for all purposes except irrigation. The valley gradually narrows into a cañon, and then "heads out" on a ridge, which once crossed, we were again in the Cienega, but much nearer its head.
events.source: #. Southeastern Arizona. Arizona Citizen. Apr 15, 1876. 6(28):4:4

events.title: Herbert Hislop, Empire Ranch, prepares four wild ducks for dinner
events.description: Herbert Hislop, Empire Ranch: 'Though we are in a rough country we try to enjoy ourselves sometimes, not being able to get a wild turkey we got 4 wild ducks, letting them hang for more than a weeks to give them a flavour and I stuffed and trussed these as best I could...'
events.source: #An Englishman's Arizona. The Ranching Letters of Herbert R.Hislop 1876-1878. Tucson, AZ: The Overland Press; 1965:50

events.title: Panther killed near Empire Ranch
events.description: Herbert Hislop, Empire Ranch: 'Not far from our ranch a man killed a panther [mountain lion] measuring 11 ft. from nose to tail .He shot it twice and thought he had killed it, but on going up discovered it was only wounded, and it sprung at him. He had a fight with it and eventually killed it but broke his rifle all to pieces.'
events.source: #An Englishman's Arizona. The Ranching Letters of Herbert R.Hislop 1876-1878. Tucson, AZ: The Overland Press; 1965:52

events.title: Panther killed in Sonoita Valley
events.description: Arizona Citizen, December 23, 1876 reports that 'A very large and bold panther [mountain lion] killed in Sonoita Valley, had captured a number of sheep and goat.' Probably the same one that Herbert Hislop wrote about.
events.source: #Brown DE. Arizona Wildlife. The Territorial Years 1863-1912. Phoenix, AZ: Arizona Game and Fish Department; 2009:191

events.title: Research Ranch Soil Inventory and Mapping Updated
events.description: D. Breckenfeld and D. Robinett (Natural Resources Conservation Service) complete the work at the Appleton-Whittell Audubon Research Ranch. This inventory is an update of soil and range information and maps of the National Audubon Society Appleton-Whittell Research Ranch that is within the Soil Survey of Santa Cruz and Parts of Cochise and Pima Counties, Arizona. That survey was completed in 1971 and reflects the conditions and needs at that time. The 2001 report provides updated soil and range information and maps for the Audubon Experimental Ranch.
events.source: #Kennedy L, Kugler P. Research Ranch Timeline. Personal communication.April 2013. #The Research Ranch, Inc.. Annual Report. Elgin, AZ: The Research Ranch, Inc; 1975

events.title: 7th Annual Science on the Sonoita Plain Symposium
events.description: Annual event at the Audubon-Whittell Research Ranch focuses on water in a special session. Presenters: Julia Fonseca: Introduction to water management Sonoita Plain; What lies below: groundwater controls on surface water in the Cienega Creek Basin; Jeanmarie Haney: Harnessing runoff on the Sonoita Plain; a primer for watershed resilience; Laura Norman: Private water wells and their place in future plans; Gary Hix: Legal and policy considerations; Linda Stitzer, with updates on other science topics: mesquite, riparian, shared history, aquatic species, recharge, soil moisture, drought wildfire, and shrubs. Partners: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Audubon Research Ranch, The Nature Conservancy, Pima County, University of Arizona.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.

events.title: Herbert Hislop hunts for turkey, ducks, quail
events.description: Herbert Hislop, Empire Ranch: 'Next week we have to go on the hunt for our Xmas dinner. We intend to go into the mountains to shoot turkey, ducks we have plenty near the house...Our dinner is to consist of suckling pig, turkey (if possible), ducks, quail and English plum-pudding...'
events.source: #An Englishman's Arizona. The Ranching Letters of Herbert R.Hislop 1876-1878. Tucson, AZ: The Overland Press; 1965:67-8

events.title: Recreation baseline monitoring survey at Las Cienegas National Conservation Area
events.description: A Recreational Survey is conducted between 2001 and 2003 by the University of Arizona by HR Gimblett and students in partnership with the Bureau of Land Management. The survey is designed to assess all types of visitor uses including hunting, camping, driving, ATV use, wildlife viewing. The data aid in designing recreational sites and facilities at Las Cienegas.
events.source: #Gimblett HR. Visitor Use Inventory, Monitoring and Recreation Impacts at Las Cienegas National Conservation Area. Tucson, AZ: Bureau of Land Management, Tucson Field Office; 2004

events.title: Erosion control seven-day workshop
events.description: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Sky Island Alliance, and the Bureau of Land Management offer a workshop to partners to learn erosion control techniques from expert Carl Zeedyk.

events.title: State of the Watershed focuses on stressors for Cienega Watershed
events.description: December State of the Watershed Workshop. Cienega Watershed Partnership and 54 stakeholders hold mini workshops based on the four technical teams set up for the Las Cienegas National Conservation Area. Focus was to identify stressors on the watershed like uses or climate change, on data gaps needed to assess status, and actions and strategies. Based on workgroups, actions were developed for water, adaptive management, partnerships and monitoring.

events.title: Early Spanish mining in Santa Rita Mountains
events.description: Spanish continue exploration for silver and gold in the Santa Rita Mountains and the SE region of Arizona as missionary settlements and military forts expand northward. Discovery of a 2,500 lb mass of silver in 1736, 20 miles southwest of Nogales greatly increases the number of prospectors. Mining on the west side of the Santa Ritas probably begins with first missions (Guevavi and Tubac) in late 1600s.
events.source:
#Wilson JP . Islands in the Desert: A History of the Uplands of Southeast Arizona. Albuquerque, NM: University of New Mexico Press; 1995:31-32
#Schrader F. Mineral Deposits of the Santa Rita and Patagonia Mountains, Arizona. US Geological Survey Bulletin. 1915. 582:1-373:21-22

events.title: 8th Annual Science on the Sonoita Plain Symposium
events.description: Annual event at the Audubon-Whittell Research Ranch focuses on invasive species in the morning session (grass, plants, frogs) and a grab-bag of science updates in the afternoon: wetlands, cuckoo distribution, watershed health indicators, ornate tree lizards, seeps and springs. Partners: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Audubon Research Ranch, The Nature Conservancy, Pima Association of Governments, University of Arizona.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.

events.title: Empire Ranch House seismic stabilization project
events.description: The Ranch House stabilization project includes reinforcing the foundations in several areas; securing the tops of the walls for structural strength; repairing interior and exterior wall surfaces; replacing the roof on the Victorian Addition; rehabilitating the Children’s Addition to make it safe for visitors; and contouring work around the house to improve drainage.
events.source: #. Empire Ranch House Stabilization Begins. Empire Ranch Foundation News. Dec, 2016. 17(4):3:3

events.title: 9th Annual Science on the Sonoita Plain Symposium
events.description: Annual event at the Audubon-Whittell Research Ranch topic: How is Science Being Used in Watershed Management? Kim McReynolds, Cooperative Extension Service, Ian Tomlinson, Vera Earl Ranch/Empire Ranch, Bill Brake, Rose Tree Ranch, Daisy Kinsey, Coronado National Forest, Karen Simms, BLM. Other paper topics: interpreting watershed history, isotope studies, brush management, Sawmill Fire, mountain lions, pupfish, lizards. Partners: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Audubon Research Ranch, The Nature Conservancy, Pima County, University of Arizona.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.

events.title: Spanish and Mexican miners work gold deposits at Guevavi
events.description: Spanish and later Mexican miners work the Guevavi gold placer mine at Guebabi Canyon on the east side of the Santa Rita Mountains. One of the earliest gold mines in southern Arizona, it is finally abandoned in 1849 when Apache raiding becomes intolerable. The site is later reworked by American prospectors in the early 1900s.
events.source: #Wilson JP . Islands in the Desert: A History of the Uplands of Southeast Arizona. Albuquerque, NM: University of New Mexico Press; 1995:157

events.title: Grasslands decline whie erosion increases
events.description: Changes in the grasslands of Southeast Arizona occur during the late 1800s. Expansion of mesquite into the grasslands and flooding and erosion events that initiate down-cutting and dewatering of creeks and tributaries are problems that challenge land managers in the Cienega Valley and beyond. While long-term variations in climate patterns have been contributing factors to landscape-wide changes, alterations initiated by grazing livestock, fire suppression, agricultural activities, well drilling, and water diversions play a significant role as well.
events.source:
#Wagoner JJ. History of the cattle industry in southern Arizona, 1540-1940. University of Arizona Bulletin. Social Science Bulletin. 1952. 23(2):1-131
#Bahre CJ, Shelton ML . Rangeland Destruction: Cattle and Drought in Southeastern Arizona at the Turn of the Century. Journal of the Southwest. 1996. 38(1):1-22

events.title: Sonoita and upper Santa Cruz valley Land Grants established
events.description: San Jose de Sonoita land grant in upper Sonoita river area and San Rafael de la Zanja Land Grant in Upper Santa Cruz River area both established. Mexican government encourages increased settlement in Pimeria Alta (later Southern Arizona) though sales of large acreage for little money. Both land grants recognized by US government following Gadsden Purchase. Purchase of historic land grants offers only mechanism to acquire large land areas for ranching.
events.source: #Officer J et al. The Pimeria Alta: Missions and More. Tucson, AZ: Southwest Mission Research Center; 1996:106-108

events.title: Richard C Dailey if La Posta Quemada Ranch dies
events.description: Richard C. 'Rick' Dailey, aged 74 dies; foreman and cattle rancher at La Posta Quemada Ranch in Colossal Cave Mountain Park from the late 1970s -2015. His family had homesteaded just across the Agua Verde Wash from the ranch in ??

events.title: Hay harvested from Cienega Valley
events.description: As early as 1874, hay is harvested in the Cienega floodplain for winter feed for livestock. The Vail family also harvest hay on the Gardner and Sanford ranches. In the 1890s the Vails hire Mormon families from St. David to cut sacaton grass from the floodplain. According to Steve Boice, Boice family harvests hay from the bajada North of Empire Gulch. Hay is first stored in the Empire corral, later in Adobe Haybarn, and subsequently in the South Barn.

events.title: High quality grazing resources noted in Cienega Valley
events.description: [the ranch is] in the middle of a splendid grazing country which is covered with grass the whole season. Mr. Fish’s title only covers 160 acres, but as he has all the water in his section of the country there is little danger of anyone settling there. The nearest water that lasts through the dry season is at least eight miles off, and every way you go for a radius of 15 miles is covered with fine bunch grass which will keep either horses or cattle rowling (sic) fat both winter and summer… I think it is as fine a cattle country as there is anywhere in the world ….' Walter Vail.

events.title: Ed Schieffelin discovers silver ore at Tombstone
events.description: Ed Schieffelin makes first discovery of silver ore at Tombstone, initiating explosion of mineral exploration throughout southern Arizona. The mines at Tombstone produce over $38.8 Million worth of silver. Prospecting for silver in the Cienega watershed was a direct result of the excitement generated by the Tombstone bonanza.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015.

events.title: Fire on La Posta Quemada Ranch in Colossal Cave Mountain Park
events.description: The history of fires on La Posta Quemada Ranch continues. The 1930s wood-frame foreman’s house (aka 'Rick Dailey’s house'), part of CCMP's National Register of Historic Places designation, burns to the ground.

events.title: John T. Dillon discovers Total Wreck mine in Empire Mtns
events.description: John Dillon, John Harvey and Walter Vail discover the Total Wreck outcrop. Mostly found in surface deposits on the NE side of the Empire Mountains.
events.source: #Dowell GP. History of the Empire Ranch. Master's Thesis. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; 1978:29

events.title: Vail's Siding facilitates trains moving east and west
events.description: Vail's Siding is built on the last stretch of land before the railroad tracks enter Cienega Creek. A siding is a track that branches out from the main line so that trains can pass each other safely.
events.source: #Lamb JJ, Pinto RL. Voices of Vail The Town Between the Tracks [Timeline]. Vail, AZ: Vail Preservation Society; 2009

events.title: Hidden Valley or Scholefield Ranch established
events.description: George Scholefield establishes the 160-acre Hidden Valley or Scholefield Ranch (also known as the Hidden Spring Ranch). It is located in present Coronado National Forest in NE Santa Rita Mountains. Scholefield and family live at the ranch until 1910 when they purchase and move to the Rosemont Hotel.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #McOmie A. M.. Dry-Farming in Arizona. Bulletin 84 University of Arizona College of Agriculture Agricultural Experiment Station. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; Feb. 1, 1918. 499-642

events.title: 10th Annual Science on the Sonoita Plain Symposium
events.description: Annual event at the Audubon-Whittell Research Ranch, focuses on 10-year history of watershed topics and science updates. State of the Cienega Watershed (Adriana Zuniga-Teran), Weather and Climate (Mike Crimmins), Ecological monitoring (Gita Bodner), Cultural heritage (Chris Schrager, Alison Bunting), Water (Mead Mier, Tom Meixner, Julia Fonseca), Chiricahua Leopard Frogs (David Hall, Philip Rosen), Trends in Stakeholder Engagement (Shela McFarlin, Karen Simms), Pronghorn Recovery on the Sonoita Plain (John Millican, Glen Dickens). Papers on: pupfish, isotope tracers, connectivity, mesquite encroachment, photographic archaeology, grassland rodents, and agency updates. Partners: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Audubon Research Ranch, The Nature Conservancy, University of Arizona, Sonoran Institute, and Bureau of Land Management Tucson.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.

events.title: Walter Vail expands stockraising business into breeding race horses
events.description: Walter Vail, like many other large cattle operators, expands stock-raising business to include breeding race horses.
events.source: #Dowell GP. History of the Empire Ranch. Master's Thesis. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; 1978:67

events.title: Rosemont Smelting and Mining Company sold to Lewisohn Bros.
events.description: In 1896, McCleary, Rose and Shaw sell their mining company to the Lewisohn brothers who begin to seriously develop the 'Old Rosemont' area. Population at Rosemont grows with incoming mining and business families.
events.source:
#Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #Schaefer J. The Anamax Project. History of the Rosemont Area in the Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Arizona State Museum; 1979
#Briggs D. History of Helvetia-Rosemont Mining District, Pima County, Arizona. Arizona Geological Survey. June 2014. Contributed Report, CR-14-D
#Ayres J. The History and Archaeology of Post-1880 Sites in the Rosemont Area, Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Tucson, AZ: Arizona State Museum Archaeological Series 147(3) ; 1984

events.title: Lewisohn Brothers patent 21 mining claims and 7 mill sites at Rosemont
events.description: Lewisohn Brothers hire George Roskruge and Ed Vail to survey Rosemont Copper Co's mining claims and mill sites in order to secure their ownership of the mineral and water resources. These are all patented in 1899.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #Ayres J. The History and Archaeology of Post-1880 Sites in the Rosemont Area, Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Tucson, AZ: Arizona State Museum Archaeological Series 147(3) ; 1984:29

events.title: Walter Vail and Carroll Gates buy land using Sierra Forest Reserve scrip
events.description: Walter Vail and partner Carroll Gates buy ~1000 (and most likely much more than that) acres worth of exchange scrip from the Sierra Forest Reserve in south central California. In 1899 they use the scrip to exchange for over 2000 acres of land in Empire Valley and other southern valleys. These sites cover many water sources.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015. #Dowell GP. History of the Empire Ranch. Master's Thesis. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; 1978

events.title: Water transported to Empire Ranch orchard
events.description: Vail designs a ditch that carries Empire Gulch water to supply the orchard and pastures below and East of the Upper Corrals. The ditch is short-lived and is soon replaced with more efficient plumbing. In the 1930s, water is transported from Empire Gulch through a six-inch pipe down to a 50’ long, double-sided concrete trough. Overflow from the trough then continues to a reservoir below or on down to orchard and vegetable fields. Remnants of the trough and piping are still visible.

events.title: Santa Rita range surveyed for future forest reserve and grazing capacity
events.description: Santa Rita region surveyed by Forest Service Grazing Expert Albert Potter and Botanist Royal Kellogg for future forest reserve. Their early assessment of the range conditions shows that the grasslands contain valuable grasses but is already at full capacity and may need to have number of livestock reduced. Vail and Gates have been experimenting with range improvements by resting rangelands by fencing 500 acres and eliminating grazing for 2 years. Potter notes that 2 years of rest has significantly rejuvenates grasses. Vail has also experimented with reseeding.
events.source:
#Kellogg R. Forest Conditions in Southern Arizona. Forest and Irrigation. 1992. 8:501-505
#Pinto RL. Cattle Grazing in the National Parks: Historical Development and History of Management in Three Southern Arizona Parks [dissertation]. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; 2014

events.title: Frogs shipped daily from Vail
events.description: Frogs captured from Cienega Creek are shipped daily from the Cienega Ranch (present-day Rancho del Lago) aboard the Sunset Express to the Adams & Co. grocery store in Tucson.
events.source: #Lamb JJ, Pinto RL. Voices of Vail The Town Between the Tracks [Timeline]. Vail, AZ: Vail Preservation Society; 2009

events.title: El Paso and Southwestern Railroad extends from Benson to Tucson
events.description: By October 1912 the track surfacing gang is at Vail and heading towards Tucson. They span Cienega Creek with a 536-foot steel bridge near Irene Crossing.
events.source: #David Myrick. Railroads of Arizona. Volume 1. The Southern Roads. Berkeley, CA: Howell North Books; 1975

events.title: Floodwaters cause railroad track washout on Cienega Creek
events.description: The Arizona Weekly Citizen reports floodwaters 60-80 feet deep rushed though Cienega Creek in places where the creek is 200 feet wide. One of the rails is taken out and and the telegraph service is disrupted. 'The track was not all washed away through the Cienega. The bridges, culverts and their approaches suffered the most.' Cribbing is being used temporarily while repairs are made.
events.source: #Staff Writer. Washout Notes. Weekly Citizen. Sept. 19, 1895.

events.title: Final surrender and deportation of Chiricahua Apache
events.description: Geronimo and the last of the Chiricahua Apache surrender for the last time on September 4,1886, in Skeleton Canyon just south of the US-Mexico border. They are transported by wagon to Fort Bowie, and on September 8, they are taken to the railroad station at the town of Bowie and placed on a special train to take them and all of the other Chiricahua Apache at the San Carlos Indian Reservation to San Augustine prison in Florida. With raiding activities ceased, Southeastern Arizona now released from development restrictions.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015.

events.title: Intermittent mining operations at Rosemont
events.description: The brief resumption of mining activity that begins in 1915 at the Narragansett mines at New Rosemont ends in 1918. The ore bodies run out of readily available mineral. Some activity continues intermittently until 1930 when funding for operations dries up with the Great Depression. Activity resumes, on a limited basis, during World War 2 because of the increased demand for copper and ends again in 1947 when demand declines.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #Schaefer J. The Anamax Project. History of the Rosemont Area in the Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Arizona State Museum; 1979:2-6

events.title: Chinese workers relocate Southern Pacific line out of Cienega Creek
events.description: Over 1,000 Chinese railroad workers relocate the Southern Pacific Railroad main line out of Cienega Creek due to frequent flooding and track washouts occurring annually. 14 tons of powder are used to speed up the realignment. An outbreak of smallpox slows the work and at least one worker dies. The town of Pantano is moved about one mile north to the new rail line.
events.source: #David Myrick. Railroads of Arizona. Volume 1. The Southern Roads. Berkeley, CA: Howell North Books; 1975:115

events.title: Pima County Supervisors accepts Colossal Cave Road as public highway
events.description: Eleven Vail residents petition the Pima County Board of Supervisors to accept 6.2 miles of Colossal Cave Road as a public highway beginning at Vail where Colossal Cave Road and the road to Benson intersect.
events.source: #Pima County Collection. Papers. Arizona Historical Society, MS0183.1864-1985.

events.title: Joe Maierhauser dies, age 79
events.description: He has been at Colossal Cave Mountain Park for 50 years. HIs wife, Martie, continues as Park Director and Operator.
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: Boice use of Agricultural Fields at Empire Ranch
events.description: Unlike the Vails, Frank Boice does not plant crops in Don Sanford’s agricultural fields. Instead, he leases those fields to a farmer. Boice retains 20 tons of hay each year as payment. An aerial photograph of the agricultural fields taken in early 1936 shows numerous separate field units, some of which are irrigated by waters diverted from the main flow of Cienega Creek.
events.source: # Chorover G, Erickson H, Pinto RL. Historic American Landscape Survey. Empire Ranch Landscape HALS AZ-19. Tucson, AZ:University of Arizona; 2016

events.title: William McCleary becomes Postmaster of Rosemont Post Office
events.description: William McCleary, part time rancher and miner, has been exploring the Santa Rita Mountains looking for copper since 1874. He lives at the Old Rosemont settlement and becomes the first Rosemont Postmaster.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: Agricultural use of Empire Ranch orchard
events.description: The orchard contains peach, pear, and apple trees during the 1930s. According to Henry Dojaquez, the Vails box and sell their fruit to local grocery stores. Frank Boice does not maintain crop productions at the orchard, and the fields gradually returned to pasture. By the late 1940s, only a few apple and pear trees are still alive. Today, with the exception of the pipeline and the partially damaged concrete trough, there is little evidence of the orchard and its agricultural activities.
events.source: #Adaptive-Reuse Plan for the Empire Ranch Headquarters. . Tucson, AZ: Statistical Research Inc.; 2004. Technical Report 03-64

events.title: Wild ducks fill the lagoons along Cienega Creek
events.description: The Arizona Daily Star reports that hunters are drawn by lagoons full of wild ducks along Cienega Creek.
events.source: #Duck Killers at Vails. Arizona Daily Star. March 3, 1894.

events.title: Empire Ranch partner, John Harvey, marries and leaves the partnership
events.description: John Harvey marries Alice Maud Annan in England in April and brings her to the Empire Ranch. In August Harvey sells his house at the Empire to Margaret Vail and leaves the partnership.
events.source: #Corkill GW, Hunt SE. Empire Ranch. Charleston, SC: Arcadia Publishing; 2011:46

events.title: Rancho del Lago sold to Cleaveland Putnam
events.description: Rancho del Lago sold to Cleaveland Putnam by Alma Monthan Tattersfield. Putnam removes the orchards, farm fields, and large trees. They are replaced with a large ranch house, castle-themed guest casitas, gate house, swimming pool, airstrip, stable, and half-mile horse track.
events.source: #Monthan, George. Vail, the Tattersfield/Monthan Family. Personal communication.2009.

events.title: Federal Immigration Service established to prevent illegal crossings
events.description: Under the Immigration Act of 1891, the US Immigration Service is established to prevent illegal crossings of both humans and livestock. The Service opens Ellis Island immigration station on January 2, 1892. The activities are managed by the Department of Homeland Security as 3 separate agencies: Customs and Border Protection, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, and US Citizenship and Immigration Services. Being further away from the international border with Mexico, current border concerns in the Cienega Watershed are less illegal immigrants and livestock crossing but more about wildlife. Are larger mammal which need large corridors blocked by the border wall and enforcement.
events.source: #Pinto R . Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015.

events.title: Empire Land & Cattle Company established
events.description: Empire Land & Cattle Co. created with Walter Vail, principal shareholder.
events.source: #Dowell GP. History of the Empire Ranch. Master's Thesis. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; 1978

events.title: Andrada Ranch Estates subdivision established
events.description: Andrada Ranch Estates, New Tucson Unit No 22 established as a subdivision of improved lots

events.title: Vail Valley Ranch development plans approved
events.description: Vail Valley Ranch development plans approved by Pima County Board of Supervisors.

events.title: Bob Boice moves to Globe, AZ to manage the Slash S ranch
events.description: Bob and Miriam Boice and their children move to Globe, AZ to manage the Slash S ranch.
events.source: #Corkill GW, Hunt SE. Empire Ranch. Charleston, SC: Arcadia Publishing; 2011:46

events.title: ASARCO and Coronado National Forest initiate Land Exchange Memorandum
events.description: ASARCO and Coronado National Forest sign a Memorandum of Understanding to initiate Land Exchange. In the mid to late 1990s, land exchanges between federal agencies with mining companies resulted in several signed Memoranda. ASARCO wanted to consolidate its mining properties and access in the Rosemont area; CNF and other agencies wanted to solve access problems to federal lands or preserve natural and cultural resource areas. In exchange for 13,272 acres at Rosemont, Coronado National Forest would have acquired 2,222 acres in Madera Canyon, Happy Valley, Rucker Canyon and Cochise Stronghold. This land exchange was strongly denounced by local and private organizations and the exchange was withdrawn in February 1998.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #Briggs D. History of Helvetia-Rosemont Mining District, Pima County, Arizona. Arizona Geological Survey. June 2014. Contributed Report, CR-14-D:8

events.title: ASARCO terminates land exchange memorandum with Coronado National Forest
events.description: ASARCO terminates the Memorandum of Understanding with the Coronado National Forest.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: Southern Pacific Railroad builds cistern at Vail
events.description: Cienega Creek/Pantano Wash is just about a mile to the northeast, but water is not easily available at the Vail siding. A well is not established at the Vail town site until 1992.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. The 1908 Old Vail Post Office. Smokesignal. Corral of the Westerners; 2011. 1-32:31

events.title: San Xavier Reservation established
events.description: Initial small reservation granted by Ulysses S. Grant in 1874. Expanded Tohono O'odham Reservation lands further west added in 1917.

events.title: Cienega Watershed Partnership becomes 501(c)(3)
events.description: The Cienega Watershed Partnership receives its 501(c)(3) designation.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.

events.title: F.C. Fenderson patent granted
events.description: Patent to Frances Cuthbert Fenderson granted.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: Juan Telles Homestead Patent
events.description: Approved Homestead Patent No. 684794 to Juan Telles.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: Empire Ranch partner, Walter Vail, marries Margaret Newhall
events.description: Walter Vail marries Margaret Newhall in New Jersey and brings her to live at the Empire Ranch. With her savings ($10,000) she is able to buy out John Harvey's partnership shares and his house.
events.source: #Corkill GW, Hunt SE. Empire Ranch. Charleston, SC: Arcadia Publishing; 2011:46

events.title: Frank and Mary Boice move to the Empire Ranch and assume management
events.description: Frank and Mary Boice and their young sons Frank (Pancho) and Robert (Bob) move to the Empire Ranch. Frank manages Empire Ranch operations.
events.source: #Corkill GW, Hunt SE. Empire Ranch. Charleston, SC: Arcadia Publishing; 2011:46

events.title: Tovrea conveys the Swinging H Ranch to Bryce Appleton
events.description: Harold C. Tovrea conveys the Swinging H Ranch (in Sections 14,13,23,27 T21S,R18E) to Ariel and Bryce Appleton. Deed recorded in Santa Cruz County, AZ. Dock 064, Page 98-100
events.source: #Kennedy L, Kugler P. Research Ranch Timeline. Personal communication.April 2013.

events.title: Las Cienegas Biological Planning aids Agua Fria planners
events.description: Agua Fria Monument Manager Rem Hawes and the planning and resources staffs visit La Cienegas National Resource Area (LCNCA) to understand the Las Cienegas collaborative model and implementation of the 2003 resource management plan. Biological Planning field day hosted by BLM.
events.source: #McFarlin S. Land Uses on Las Cienegas National Conservation Area. Personal Communication.Nov 2016.

events.title: Whetstone Mtns added to Santa Rita NF
events.description: The Whetstone Mountains are added to the Santa Rita National Forest in 1907. Both ranges along with the Santa Catalina and the Rincon Mountains become the Coronado National Forest in 1908. Other National Forests are added to Coronado in following years.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: BLM creates Arizona State Office to manage Arizona public lands
events.description: The Bureau of Land Management has re-organized multiple times but in 1961, it creates a state office system. The Arizona State Office is created to oversee Arizona public lands in multiple area and district offices. The new state director reports to Washington DC rather than to a regional office. All previous land offices have been eliminated. AZ State Director: Fred J. Weiler 1961-1970.

events.title: National Park Service established
events.description: Organic Act of 1916 establishes National Park Service. Agency to administer national parks and monuments and later other different types of park units.

events.title: Kentucky Camp restoration continues
events.description: The Friends of Kentucky Camp organize volunteers to maintain the historic Stetson's Cabin, named for the original investor, James Stetson, including adding a porch to the cabin, and restoring features to make it amenable for current public uses.
events.source: #Friends of Kentucky Camp. Various Articles. Kentucky Camp Chronicle [Newsletter]. 1995 - 2015.

events.title: Santa Rita Forest Ranger Armour Scholefield dies
events.description: First Santa Rita Forest Ranger, Armour Scholefield, stationed at Rosemont, dies of typhoid fever at age 23.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: Solomon Lick sells Mountain Springs Ranch
events.description: Lick sells to William Shaw & John Craps and Mary Anna Shaw; Shaw operates the ranch through 1918, and it is known as Shaw's Ranch until 1933.
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: Titus homestead patent
events.description: Patent of T.B.Titus homestead.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: TB Titus Homestead Patent (future Research Ranch)
events.description: Homestead Patent No. 855360 to Thaddeus B. Titus (Included land in Section 27-the Appleton-Whittell Research Ranch).
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: Disney films and releases TV movie, The Outlaw Cats of Colossal Cave
events.description: The movie is the story of a mother bobcat and her kittens in Colossal Cave, and is very loosely based on the Cave Bandit Legend; all filming is done in and around the Park
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: Saguaro National Monument proclaimed
events.description: Saguaro National Monument proclaimed by executive order of Herbert Hoover. Monument was excised from Coronado National Forest lands and placed under administration of Coronado National Forest.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015.

events.title: Kentucky Camp's Santa Rita Water and Mining Company sells
events.description: With financial entanglements of the investors and no cash available, Kentucky Camp's Santa Rita WMCo sells at Sheriff's Sale. One of the original investors, George McAneny, purchases the gold mining interests outright that he had formerly partnered in with others. He is not able to raise additional investments after struggling. The mining interests go stagnant for a while.
events.source: #Orell FL. Kentucky Camp and the Santa Rita Water and Mining Company. Kentucky Camp Chronicle [Newsletter]. 1998. February

events.title: Greaterville post office closes
events.description: Greaterville post office closes; Daniel Johnson postmaster.

events.title: Saguaro National Monument transferred to NPS from USFS
events.description: Under Franklin Delano Roosevelt's Executive Order 6166, the administration of Saguaro National Monument is transferred from US Forest Service to the National Park Service. Transfer includes all other national monuments, battle fields, and historic sites.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015.

events.title: Victorian Addition rooms at Empire Ranch remodeled
events.description: Rooms in the Victorian Addition of the Empire Ranch House remodeled by Frank and Mary Boice.
events.source: #Corkill GW, Hunt SE. Empire Ranch. Charleston, SC: Arcadia Publishing; 2011.:46

events.title: Cienega Watershed Partnership adds Directors
events.description: Kelly Mott LaCroix and Tom Meixner added to Board of Directors.

events.title: National Mail and Transportation Company takes over from Southern Pacific Mail Line
events.description: National Mail and Transportation Company takes over from the Southern Pacific Mail Line; both these lines use the stage stop at Mountain Springs Ranch (today La Posta Quemada Ranch in Colossal Cave Mountain Park).
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: John S. Sullivan sells La Posta Quemada Ranch to Jack Lewis
events.description: John S. Sullivan sells La Posta Quemada to Jack Lewis, rancher and developer with dreams of condominiums and using the ranch as resort/guest ranch.The dreams don't materialize, but Lewis makes major changes to some of the historic buildings

events.title: Clean Water Act regulations pass
events.description: As amended in 1972, the Clean Water Act (CWA) establishes the basic structure for regulating discharges of pollutants into the waters of the US and regulating quality standards for surface waters. The basis for CWA had been enacted in 1948 (the Federal Water Pollution Control Act), but the Act is significantly reorganized and expanded. The 1972 amendments: establish the basic structure for regulating pollutant discharges into water; give the EPA the authority to implement pollution control programs such as setting wastewater standards for industry. This applies to development and mining operations within the Cienega Watershed.

events.title: JD Riggs Homestead Patent
events.description: Approved Homestead Patent No. 922230 to John D. Riggs.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: Otto Schley, Vail Postmaster and first mayor, dies
events.description: Otto Schley is last seen on December 10, 1914.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: CWP Back Then Work Group begins
events.description: Back Then is spun out of the Cienega Watershed Partnership Oral History Work Group. Back Then partners include oral history groups plus other scientists interested in applying the past to current issues; offering internships in oral history training in partnership with University of Arizona Library Sciences. Funding assistance from the Bureau of Land Management Tucson for oral histories.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.
events.tags: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Empire Ranch Foundation, Bureau of Land Management

events.title: Cattleman Charles (Chay) Day buys Mountain Springs Ranch from Pete McDaniel
events.description: Day renames the ranch La Posta Quemada Ranch; he builds a headquarters house at the site of the old adobe Mountain Springs Hotel, incorporating some of the structure.
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: The First Earth Day
events.description: Earth Day is a social and political grassroots movement initiated by Senator Gaylord Nelson and Representative Pete McCloskey to protest against the deterioration of air, water, and other natural resources. Now an annual event, the movement has inspired establishment of the Environmental Protection Agency and passage of the Clean Air, Clean Water, and Endangered Species Acts.

events.title: J.L. Finley Patents approved
events.description: Homestead Patent No. 803174 and Stock Raising Homestead Patent No. 803175 to James L. Finley; Section 14.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: WT Roath Stock Raising Homestead Patent
events.description: Stock Raising Homestead Patent No. 931438 to Willard T. Roath.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: Cienega Creek Watershed Conservation Workshop
events.description: Cienega Creek Watershed Conservation Workshop is held in December 2006 with 3 dozen partners to produce a watershed vision.

events.title: F.C. Fenderson Corrective Homestead Patent
events.description: Corrective Homestead Patent No. 813897 to Francis Cuthbert Fenderson; Section 22.
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: La Posta Quemada Ranch sold
events.description: Charles Day sells La Posta Quemada Ranch to Joseph Timan, land investor and developer, who in turn sells to Orel Burris, a cattleman and entrepreneur.
events.source: #Maierhauser MK, Cockrum EL. The Timeline: The Intertwined Histories of Colossal Cave and La Posta Quemada Ranch. Tucson, AZ: Pima County Parklands Foundation; 2000

events.title: Antelope Days held at the Research Ranch
events.description: Antelope Days held at the Appleton-Whittell Audubon Research Ranch

events.title: Burials are found along Cienega Creek
events.description: Bryon Cummings, director of the Arizona State Museum, excavates two burials exposed by erosion along Cienega Creek, 3.75 meters below the modern ground surface. Based on this depth, Cummings assigns an ancient date to the human remains.
events.source: #Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2

events.title: Mary Boice responsible for historic landscaping at Empire Ranch
events.description: Besides being a valuable ranch hand, Mary Boice is an avid gardener. She transforms the previously spare habitat around the main house with lush lawns, shade trees, and flower beds of tulips, roses, and irises. In 1940, she and Frank add a swimming pool at the northwest corner of the Adobe Haybarn. Little of that landscaping remains today.
events.source: # Chorover G, Erickson H, Pinto RL. Historic American Landscape Survey. Empire Ranch Landscape HALS AZ-19. Tucson, AZ:University of Arizona; 2016

events.title: Public Sale Patent to Appletons
events.description: Public Sale Patent No. 1215504 to Francis Henry Appleton (lots 4 & 5 adjacent to Homestead Patent No. 855360).
events.source: #Colllins GE. A History of the Lands in the National Audubon Society's Research Ranch near Elgin, in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. Manuscript on file ; 2008

events.title: Sky Island Alliance initiates road rehabilitation at Las Cienegas
events.description: During the Las Cienegas Land Use planning process, individual roads were evaluated for continued use or rehabilitation. Through the Sky Island Alliance volunteer program, some roads received special attention to close or rehabilitate.

events.title: Cienega Watershed Partners hold Back Then Potluck
events.description: Kick-off for the Back Then Work Group to contact local individuals about oral histories and records. Held at Elgin Community Club. Participation by others aid the Back Then work group to identify individuals for potential interviews.
events.source: #McFarlin Shela. Cienega Watershed Partnership Files. Personal Communication.2017.
events.tags: Cienega Watershed Partnership, Empire Ranch Foundation

events.title: Kentucky Camp adds new caretaker trailer and improvements
events.description: Friends of Kentucky Camp partnering with the Coronado National Forest continue to improve and maintain the Kentucky Camp historic site. Fully open for public visits but needing some improvements and on-site care, a new caretaker trailer is installed. New internal doors installed in Headquarters Building.
events.source: #Friends of Kentucky Camp. Various Articles. Kentucky Camp Chronicle [Newsletter]. 1995 - 2015.

events.title: Boice distribution of water to Empire Ranch Orchard
events.description: Water for the Empire Ranch orchard is transported from Empire Gulch through a six-inch pipe down to a trough west of the cottonwood grove lining the Gulch. The water fills a 50’ long, double-sided, concrete trough that supplies cattle and horses. Its overflow then continues on down to vegetable fields and apple and pear trees.After 1950 orchard and fields were no longer maintained by Boices.
events.source: # Chorover G, Erickson H, Pinto RL. Historic American Landscape Survey. Empire Ranch Landscape HALS AZ-19. Tucson, AZ:University of Arizona; 2016

events.title: Arivaca and Sopori land grants abandoned
events.description: Arivaca and Sopori Spanish land grants and associated mines abandoned following Pima Indian revolts.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015. #Wilson JP . Islands in the Desert: A History of the Uplands of Southeast Arizona. Albuquerque, NM: University of New Mexico Press; 1995:133-138

events.title: Silver and gold mining operations near Tubac
events.description: Silver mining operations on the west side of the Santa Rita mountains near Tubac.
events.source: #Wilson JP . Islands in the Desert: A History of the Uplands of Southeast Arizona. Albuquerque, NM: University of New Mexico Press; 1995:42-43

events.title: JK Brown locates Narragansett claim at New Rosemont
events.description: James K. Brown locates the Narragansett claim near the crest of the Santa Rita range in upper McCleary Canyon but does not develop it. The claim is later sold to WR Ramsdell in 1915.
events.source:
#Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #Schaefer J. The Anamax Project. History of the Rosemont Area in the Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Arizona State Museum; 1979:25
#Schrader F. Mineral Deposits of the Santa Rita and Patagonia Mountains, Arizona. US Geological Survey Bulletin. 1915. 582:1-373:128-129
#Ayres J. The History and Archaeology of Post-1880 Sites in the Rosemont Area, Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Tucson, AZ: Arizona State Museum Archaeological Series 147(3) ; 1984:10

events.title: Morrill Act provides for land grant colleges
events.description: The Morrill Act of 1862 is signed by President Lincoln to establish Land Grant Colleges mostly in western states to support education in agriculture and engineering. Thomas Jefferson had recognized and pushed for public institutions that would bring practical knowledge to the people and would use science to address immediate issues and problems. Arizona's land grant college is the University of Arizona.

events.title: Retaining wall built behind Cabin A at Kentucky Camp
events.description: Retaining wall built behind Cabin A at Kentucky Camp to mitigate damage from hillside pressure.

events.title: Pantano Creek Waters and Tributaries Rights Determination Case
events.description: Tattersfield vs. Putnam in the matter of determination of the relative rights to the waters of Pantano Creek and its tributaries in Pima County. T16S, R16E, Gila and Salt River Base and Meridian. Cleaveland Putnam's right to use five acre feet of water per annum for stock and domestic purposes and for irrigation upon 128.842 acres of land.

events.title: Santiago Leon Homestead Patent
events.description: The heirs of Santiago Leon claim lot two of Section four in Township sixteen south of Range sixteen east of the Gila and Salt River Meridian, Arizona, containing twenty acres and seven hundredths of an acre. Patent Number 1067182
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Smith Lever Act of 1914 creates Cooperative Extension System
events.description: The Smith-Lever Act creates the Cooperative Extension System to further spread knowledge of agriculture, economics, leadership, and home economics into each state and county. State and Federal funds are directed to apply modern science to the specific needs of the communities. The land grant colleges provide the practical information that would be disseminated by farm and ranch advisers through non-formal educational programs.

events.title: Water use agreement between Cleaveland, Putnam and Mattie Adkins
events.description: Legal agreement reached between Cleaveland and Margaret Putnam and Mattie Adkins to divert water from the irrigation canal carrying water from Cienega Creek to Rancho del Lago: On Sundays between noon and 6:00 p.m., water is diverted to irrigate Mattie Adkins' crops.

events.title: Improved breeding in the Empire herds using Durham and Hereford strains
events.description: Walter Vail improves quality of beef in his livestock herds by interbreeding with Durham strains in 1879 and in 1884. He begins developing purebred Hereford herds at Happy Valley Ranch and on range in Sulphur Springs Valley in 1889. Through the middle of the 20th century, purebred Herefords can command considerably higher prices.
events.source:
# Chorover G, Erickson H, Pinto RL. Historic American Landscape Survey. Empire Ranch Landscape HALS AZ-19. Tucson, AZ:University of Arizona; 2016
#Dowell GP. History of the Empire Ranch. Master's Thesis. Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona; 1978:30-33

events.title: Kentucky Camp volunteers add new porch to the Headquarters
events.description: New porch added to the Headquarters at Kentucky Camp by the Friends of Kentucky Camp. The Headquarters has served many functions in the past including a kitchen, living space, gold processing. Because it has now been rehabilitated, the Headquarters is interpreted and opened to public visits.
events.source: #Friends of Kentucky Camp. Various Articles. Kentucky Camp Chronicle [Newsletter]. 1995 - 2015.

events.title: Abram Bravo Homestead Patent near Vail
events.description: Abram Bravo claims 160 acres in Township 13 south, Range 13 east in the southeast quarter of Section 21.

events.title: Victor Chavez Homestead Patent
events.description: Victor Chavez files on 160 acres in Township 16 south, Range 16 east, the southeast quarter of Section 14.

events.title: Teclo Lujan Homestead Patent
events.description: Teclo Lujan proves up on 160 acres. The southeast quarter of Section 14 in Township sixteen south and Range sixteen east.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Lehmann lovegrass introduced on Santa Rita Experimental Range
events.description: Lehmann lovegrass (an African exotic plant) is introduced on Santa Rita Experimental Range. The non-native species was welcomed by some.
events.source: #Cable DR . Lehmann Lovegrass in the Santa Rita Experimental Range,1937-1968 . Journal of Range Management. 1971. 24:17-21

events.title: Brush occurrence survey in Southern Arizona
events.description: During the 1930s, the encroachment of shrubs receives attention. A survey of 'Occurrence of Shrubs on Range Areas in South-eastern Arizona' is conducted in 1937, and finds the increase in shrubs is almost universal throughout Southern Arizona. Mesquite is found to be the most widespread species. Several tests on techniques of killing shrubs are conducted in 1940s.
events.source: #Sayre N.. The cattle boom in Southern Arizona: towards a critical political ecology. Journal of the Southwest. 1999. 41(2):239-271

events.title: Benito Dominguez Homestead Patent near Vail
events.description: Benito Dominguez files a cash entry for 160 acres located in the western half of the southeast corner of Section 24, Township 16 south, Range 16 east, and the northeast corner of the southwest corner of Section 24, Township 16 south, Range 16 east, and the southeast corner of the southeast corner of Section 24, Township 16 east, Range 16 east.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Vails sell Total Wreck mine
events.description: Vails sell Total Wreck mine.
events.source: #Pinto RL. Cienega Timeline. Personal Communication.Feb 1, 2015.

events.title: Martinez and Lopez families ranch in the Rosemont mine area
events.description: Martinez and Lopez families are known to have ranched in the Rosemont Mine area in NE Santa Rita Mountains. Their ranch lands are never patented..
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: McCleary, Rose and Shaw incorporate Rosemont Smelting and Mining Co.
events.description: William McCleary, L. J. Rose, and William Shaw and others incorporate the Rosemont Smelting and Mining Co. in Old Rosemont in NE Santa Rita Mountains. The company employs mostly Mexican workers The organization is short-lived when their smelter blows up. They are bought out in 1896 by the Lewisohn Brothers who rename it the Rosemont Mining and Smelting Co. and later change the organization's name to the Rosemont Copper Co.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015. #Schaefer J. The Anamax Project. History of the Rosemont Area in the Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Arizona State Museum; 1979:21

events.title: Cienega Valley extensively surveyed for prehistoric sites
events.description: Earl Swanson, University of Arizona student, undertakes the first extensive archaeological (but not systematic) survey of Cienega valley for his Master's thesis. He discovers many ceramic (pottery) and preceramic period sites, representing varying periods of settlement in the watershed
events.source:
#Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2
#Swanson EH Jr. An Archaeological Survey of the Empire Valley, Arizona . Tucson,AZ: University of Arizona, Department of Anthropology Unpublished Master's thesis ; 1951

events.title: Carter D Crane Homestead Patent near Vail
events.description: Carter D Crane claims a 280-acre homestead entry in the north half of the southeast quarter, the north half of the southwest quarter of the northwest quarter and the east half of the northwest quarter of Section fifteen in Township sixteen south of Range sixteen east of the Gila and Salt River Meridian. Carter Crane, along with John B Fraker, develop a large farming operation watered by waters channeled from Cienega Creek.

events.title: John B Fraker Homestead Patent
events.description: John B. Fraker claims 160 acres in Township 16 south, Range 16 east in the South half of the southeast quarter of Section 4 and in Township 16 south, Range 16 east in the east one half of the northeast quarter of Section 9. John B Fraker, along with Carter Crane, developed a large farming operation watered by waters channeled from Cienega Creek

events.title: Cienega Watershed Partnership elects officers
events.description: CWP Board of Directors: Martie Maierhauser (Chair), David Bertelsen (Secretary), Lynsey Miller (Treasurer), James Clampet, Ron Horsmann, Bill Savary, Jeff Williamson, Ian Tomlinson, Shela McFarlin, Trevor Hare

events.title: Evidence of early maize agriculture discovered
events.description: In Cienega Creek, alluvial sediments date stratigraphically to the same period as the excavated site AZ EE:2:30 (1000 BC). In these sediments, Paul Martin and James Schoenwetter discover pollen evidence of early maize agriculture.
events.source:
#Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2
#Martin PS. The Last 10,000 Years: A Fossil Pollen Record of the American Southwest . Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona Press; 1963
#Schoenwetter J. Pollen Analysis of Sediments from Matty Wash. . Tucson,AZ: University of Arizona, Unpublished Master's thesis ; 1960

events.title: Mattie Canyon excavations define San Pedro stage preceramic site
events.description: Frank Eddy excavates the preceramic site AZ EE:2:30. The site is buried over 5 meters in the alluvium but exposed on the channel floor of Mattie Wash. It is rich and varied in archaeological remains. Eddy terms this a San Pedro phase base site (3300 to 1950 years BP). .
events.source:
#Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2
#Eddy FW, Cooley ME. Cultural and Environmental History of Cienega Valley, Southeastern Arizona . Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona Press Anthropological Papers No. 43.; 1983

events.title: Stratigraphy and archaeological sites prove 3000 year occupation
events.description: Frank Eddy, University of Arizona student, records the alluvial stratigraphy and ceramic and preceramic sites along Mattie Canyon and Cienega Creek. Eddy applies a unique interdisciplinary approach to archaeological research. He collaborates with a geologist, palynologist and malacologist. Eddy's work demonstrates the rich cultural history spanned more than 3,000 years and that spatial patterning of sites could be tied to changes in the floodplain environment.
events.source:
#Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2
#Eddy FW, Cooley ME. Cultural and Environmental History of Cienega Valley, Southeastern Arizona . Tucson, AZ: University of Arizona Press Anthropological Papers No. 43.; 1983

events.title: Rosemont Administrative Site in Santa Rita Mtns withdrawn from public entry
events.description: Rosemont Administrative Site in the Santa Rita National Forest (later Coronado National Forest) is withdrawn from public entry (no homestead claims allowed).The site encompasses 470 acres in Sections 28, 29, and 33 in T18S R16E. The headquarters used by Armour and his brother Carl Scholefield is located in McCleary Canyon. Administrative sites are used as the Forest Ranger's office, stables, and home and will have an assured water source for continued habitation. The Rosemont Administrative site is abandoned in 1913 and returned as normal forest service grazing land or for claim as a forest homestead.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: Double-sided cattle troughs at Empire Ranch constructed by Banning Vail
events.description: Banning Vail, who manages the Empire Ranch from 1913 to 1927, designs and builds double-sided troughs to supply water to two herds separated by a fence. In addition to the 50-foot long orchard trough, two others of the same design can still be found at the South Barn pasture and at a corral at the old Cienega Ranch.
events.source: # Chorover G, Erickson H, Pinto RL. Historic American Landscape Survey. Empire Ranch Landscape HALS AZ-19. Tucson, AZ:University of Arizona; 2016

events.title: Santiago Leon Homestead Patent
events.description: Santiago Leon proves up on the southwest quarter of section thirty three in Township fifteen south of Range sixteen east of the Gila and Salt River Meridian, Arizona, containing one hundred sixty acres. Patent Number 282047.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Discoveries of deeply buried archaeological remains along Cienega Creek
events.description: E. Thomas Hemmings, M.D., Robinson, and R.N. Rogers recover human burials exposed in a vertical face below over 5 meters of alluvium, affirming that deep deposits contain rich archaeological horizons. The excavation of site AZ EE:2:50 contributes to understanding not just who might have lived in the area but confirms the depth of significant sites.
events.source: #Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2

events.title: Central Arizona Project authorized
events.description: After 22 years of advocacy by the Central Arizona Project Association, President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the bill authorizing funds for the construction of the Central Arizona Project aqueduct. The Department of the Interior and the Bureau of Reclamation are assigned to fund and construct the project. When CAP brings Colorado River water to Tucson, many deep water wells that tap the Tucson aquifer are shut down. Land subsidence declines and water levels in aquifer slowly rise.
events.source: #Central Arizona Project. About Us: History. . 2015.

events.title: Narragansett Copper Company incorporated
events.description: Narragansett Copper Co. incorporated with W.R. Ramsdell as president.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: Jose Maria Romero Homestead Patent
events.description: Jose Maria Romero proves up on the west half of the southwest quarter of Section twenty-eight and the west half of the northwest quarter of Section thirty-three in Township fifteen south of Range sixteen east of the Gila and Salt River Meridian, Arizona, containing one hundred sixty acres.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Albert Steinfeld acquires the Narragansett Copper Company
events.description: Albert Steinfeld acquires the Narragansett to satisfy his claims against the company.
events.source: #Gillespie W. A Rosemont Timeline 1879-1999. Personal Communication.May 8, 2015.

events.title: Casimiro Bravo Homestead Patent
events.description: Casimiro Bravo proves up on his homestead land claim containing two hundred eighty acres located in the north half of the southeast quarter, the north half of the southwest quarter, the southwest quarter of the northwest quarter and the east half of the northwest quarter of Section 15 in Township 16 south of Range sixteen east of the Gila and Salt River Meridian, Arizona.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Jose Maria Romero Homestead Patent
events.description: Jose Maria Romero proves up on the southwest quarter of the southwest quarter of Section twenty-six, the south half of the southeast quarter and the south half of the southwest quarter of Section twenty-seven, and the southeast quarter of the southeast quarter of Section twenty-eight in Township fifteen south of Range sixteen east of the Gila and Salt River Meridian, Arizona, containing two hundred forty acres. Patent Number 1043206.
events.source: #Lamb, JJ. Vail - Town Between the Tracks. ; Manuscript

events.title: Anamax Rosemont archaeological surveys record 85 historic sites
events.description: To support the Anamax-Rosemont land exchange proposal on Coronado National Forest, 30 square miles are surveyed on Forest Service lands and associated Anamax patented or fee lands between 1975 and 1982. Both Old Rosemont in Wasp Canyon and New Rosemont in upper McCleary Canyon are recorded.
events.source: #Ayres J. The History and Archaeology of Post-1880 Sites in the Rosemont Area, Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona. Tucson, AZ: Arizona State Museum Archaeological Series 147(3) ; 1984

events.title: Surveys and excavations for proposed Anamax land exchange
events.description: Arizona State Museum conducts a large-scale intensive survey and excavation project on the proposed land exchange between the Coronado National Forest and the Anamax Mining Corporation. Numerous Archaic, Hohokam, and historic sites near Rosemont are identified and excavated, greatly expanding archaeologists' understanding of the area. Test excavations or more thorough data recovery were made at 22 Hohokam, 11 Archaic, and 3 Sobaipuri sites. Excavations included the only documented Hohokam ballcourt in the Cienega watershed.
events.source:
#Huckell BB . History of Archaeological Research in the Cienega Valley . Archaeology Southwest. 2001. 15(4):2
#Ferg A, Rozen KC, Deaver WL, Tagg MD, Phillips DA Jr, Gregory DA. Hohokam Habitation Sites in the Northern Santa Rita Mountains, Arizona State Museum Archaeological Series 147(3) . Tucson, AZ: Arizona State Museum ; 1984
#Huckell BB. The Archaic occupation of the Rosemont Area, Northern Santa Rita Mountains, Southeastern Arizona, Arizona State Museum Archaeology Series 147(1). Tucson, AZ: Arizona State Museum ; 1984
#Tagg MD, Ervin RG, Huckell BB editors. Miscellaneous Archaeological Studies in the Anamax-Rosemont Land Exchange Area, Arizona State Museum Archaeology Series 147(4). 1984; 1984

events.title: Sylvester D. Bell Homestead Patent
events.description: Sylvester D. Bell cash entry: Northeast quarter of the northeast quarter of Section twenty and the northwest quarter of the northwest quarter of Section twenty-one in Township 13 south oRange 13 east of the Gila and Salt River meridian, Arizona, containing eighty acres.

events.title: Arizona State Museum investigates 30 historic sites for Anamax
events.description: Following the earlier 1975 through 1980 surveys, this project relocates historic sites.
